Description:  Conduct thorough dermatological consultations and assessments of patients. Diagnose and treat various skin conditions, including but not limited to acne, eczema, psoriasis, dermatitis, and skin infections. Perform dermatological procedures such as biopsies, excisions, and cryotherapy. Prescribe appropriate medications, topical treatments, and skincare regimens. Provide cosmetic dermatology services, including Botox, dermal fillers, chemical peels, and laser treatments. Perform skin cancer screenings and provide treatment for skin cancer patients. Educate and counsel patients on skincare practices, preventive measures, and treatment options. Stay updated with the latest dermatological advancements, research, and treatment modalities.Skills

 Residency or specialized training in dermatology.
 Valid medical license and board certification in dermatology.
